decoworld.model.world.combat.stats

Class StatEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.combat.stats.StatEvent

  • public class StatEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a statistic event. Statistic events are sent to objects that have added themselves to a HasStats object as a StatListener. See addStatListener() in HasStats

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StatEvent(StatEventType eventType, StatType statType, com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Object> attachment, WorldEntity sender)
      Creates a new stat event with an attachment
      StatEvent(StatEventType eventType, StatType statType, WorldEntity sender)
      Creates a new stat event with no attachment

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Object> getAttachment()
      Returns an optinal event attachment.
      StatEventType getEventType()
      Returns the type of statistic event.
      WorldEntity getSender()
      Returns the HasStats object that sent this event.
      StatType getStatType()
      Returns the type of statistic to which this event may apply.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getAttachment

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Object> getAttachment()
        Returns an optinal event attachment.
        Returns:
        attachment - the event attachment

      • getEventType

        public StatEventType getEventType()
        Returns the type of statistic event. See StatEventType
        Returns:
        type - the type of health event.

      • getStatType

        public StatType getStatType()
        Returns the type of statistic to which this event may apply. See StatType
        Returns:
        type - the type of health event.

      • getSender

        public WorldEntity getSender()
        Returns the HasStats object that sent this event. For example, if an object was damaged, it would be the source for a stat modification event.
        Returns:
        - the HasStats object that sent this event.
